param

Class ConstraintChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • param.ConstraintChecker
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RahdConstraintChecker

    class ConstraintChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    Checks if functions are (strictly) larger than zero in whole region. This class implements only an approximate check. This means, that functions are only evaluated in a finite number of points, so that it is unlikely but not impossible that there are other points in the region which are below (or equal) to zero. Derived classes might use a constraint solver to guarantee validity of this check.
    Author:
    Ernst Moritz Hahn (University of Oxford)

    • Method Detail

      • mainCheck

        boolean mainCheck(Region region,
                  Function constraint,
                  boolean strict)
        Main decision check. In this class, does nothing. Derived class could override this method for instance by calling an external decision procedure, use a library to decide validity in a given region, etc.
        Parameters:
        region - region for which to check validity of constraint
        constraint - constraint to check (whether >=/> 0)
        strict - true iff ">" shold be checked rathern than ">="
        Returns:
        true

      • preCheck

        boolean preCheck(Region region,
                 Function constraint,
                 boolean strict)
        Does a quick pre-check by evaluating constraint at random points.
        Parameters:
        region - region for which to check validity of constraint
        constraint - constraint to check (whether >=/> 0)
        strict - true iff ">" shold be checked rathern than ">="
        Returns:
        true if no counterexamples to validity found

      • check

        boolean check(Region region,
              Function constraint,
              boolean strict)
        Checks whether constraint holds in given region.
        Parameters:
        region - region for which to check validity of constraint
        constraint - constraint to check (whether >=/> 0)
        strict - true iff ">" shold be checked rathern than ">="
        Returns:
        true iff function values are (strictly) larger than zero in whole region
